src:
Jutri pogovor s prevajalko in Sovretovo nagrajenko Bredo Biščak
04 Nov 2019, 06:02 by Maja Pertič Gombač

Kulturni klub Koper bo na jutrišnjem Pogovoru o branju ob 20. uri v foajeju Gledališča Koper gostil prevajalko Bredo Biščak, doma tako na Škofijah kakor v Logatcu, ki je za izvrsten prevod romana Johna Williamsa Avgust (Mladinska knjiga, 2018) prejela letošnjo Sovretovo nagrado, naše najvišje prevajalsko priznanje.



Breda Biščak Foto: Andraž Gombač

KOPER > V pogovoru z Jasno Čebron bo gostja razkrila “prevajalske skrbi in radosti” ter kako skrivnost iz zaodrja enega najredkeje z žarometi javnega zanimanja osvetljenega poklica.
Breda Biščak je med drugim prevedla tudi uspešnico istega avtorja Stoner, zgodovinski uspešnici Podivjana celina (Modrijan, 2014) in Strah in svoboda (Modrijan, 2018) britanskega zgodovinarja Keitha Lowa, a njen najljubši, obenem pa tudi eden najzahtevnejših, je prevod avtobiografije Vladimirja Nabokova Govori, spomin.
text:
Tomorrow we will talk with the translator and Sovret award winner Breda Biščak
04 Nov 2019, 06:02 by Maja Pertic Gombac

The Koper Cultural Club will host Breda Biščak, translator at the Diocese of Koper Theater tomorrow, at home in both Diocese and Logatec, who received this year's Sovret Prize for an excellent translation of John Williams' August (Mladinska knjiga, 2018), our highest translation recognition.



Breda Biščak Photo: Andraž Gombac

KOPER> In an interview with Jasna Cebron, the guest will reveal "translation concerns and joys" and how the secret from behind is one of the rarest with the headlights of public interest in the illuminated profession.
Breda Biščak also translated the bestseller by the same author Stoner, the historical blockbuster Podivjana continent (Modrijan, 2014) and Fear and Freedom (Modrijan, 2018) by British historian Keith Low, but her favorite, as well as one of the most demanding ones, is a translation of Vladimir Nabokov's autobiography Speak, memory.
